intro: Coussapoa oligoneura, commonly known as the Brazilian velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological and horticultural studies.
